questions.question: Based on this image, which of the following statements are true? (Choose three.)
answers: A. Attributes from two tables populate a table with the same name as a ServiceNow CMDB table.
B. This operation is more than likely a part of a step on a pattern set to Application Pattern Type.
C. If a value is unmatched, it is still merged into the Target Table.
D. For this operation to run, there must be some data in the process.executablePath variable.
E. This is a horizontal pattern of type "infrastructure."

comments.content: E seems more correct than A
ABD is correct considering that the table being merged to is the Web Server table
ABD might actually be correct considering that the table being merged to is the Web Server table

questions.question: Based on the following images, which choice best describes what occurs if Discovery sets the name attribute of a discovered Windows Server CI to 'Windows1' and then Altiris discovery runs detecting 'Windows2' for the name attribute on the same CI?
answers: A. The name of the CI stays 'Windows1'.
B. The name of the CI changes to 'Windows2'.
C. The name of the CI does not populate with either discovery.
D. The CI is not discovered because Discovery is not listed in either image.

comments.content: Lowest (aka highest) priority takes priority, therefore A.

The answer would be "B" based on the higher priority being "ServiceNow." Once the source from the higher priority updates the field it checks the "cmdb_datasource_last_update" table. If the fields been updated the lower priority source is skipped. 

Resource: https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0756709 (Updated Jan 18 2024)
replies: Sorry this wouldn't allow me to correct this. Please disregard the answer is A

comments.content:
Correct answer: A. The name of the CI stays ‘Windows1’.
Reasoning: If multiple data sources are authorized to update the same table in the CMDB based on reconciliation definition, then a lower order data source has higher priority than a higher order data source.
The answer is A due to the order on the Data Source Precedents.
the rules run in the order from lowest to highest.
The answer is "A", no question about it. Why do they have marked "B" as Correct answer ??
I agree the answer should be A, this is based on the ranking of 100  for ServiceNow(higher  than 300 for Altrium)

questions.question: For the Parse Variable pattern operation, what is required to have two different parsing methods to populate variables?
answers: A. Two different Debug Mode sessions.
B. A tabular and a scalar variable.
D. Two different Define Parsing selections on the same step.

comments.content: one step = 1 parsing method, you cant have 2 (try it in discovery pattern)

questions.question: Which best describes Discovery schedule of type Configuration Item?
answers: A. Verifies Configuration Item data from the scanned IP ranges against the data in the CMDB.
B. Creates only a list of discovered IPs in both IPv4 and IPv6 formats.
C. Collects complete information from the scanned IP ranges and sends it to the CMDB.
D. Directly populates records in the assets table.

comments.content: A and C are very close, the only ambiguity is the verification  (Does CMDB do verification accepting CI's )

questions.question: When installing a MID Server on a Windows platform, which right must be associated when creating a Service Account?

comments.content:
1. You can allow read-only in a AD domain without making the account Domain Admin

2. MID has to have log on as a service rights in order to run the MID services on the Windows server.

The provided service account credentials must meet the following requirements in addition to being a valid account.
The user cannot be a local system or an administrator level account (local admin, domain admin, etc.)
The service account provided has the log on as service right, which is required for an account to be used as the log on user for a service.
Know this one from setting up multiple MID servers

Username of the service account that will be used to run the MID Server service. For information on creating service accounts, see Create a Windows service account with "Log on as Service" [KB0867669].

questions.question: Which of the below choices are needed for Quick Discovery? (Choose two.)
In order to use Debug from the Pattern Designer, you must have what?

comments.content: You have to connect to an actual CI in order to debug it. B is correct
You need admin access. C is correct.

It has to be B, bear in mind that a CI has a reasonable number of attributes that a pattern will identify during the discovery process. No Discoverable CI, no point using a pattern, no reason to debug!
Also, pd_admin is NOT the same as the admin role.
replies: I did the SAM Exam, and in the exam they called "sam_admin" as "admin" only, maybe its the case here.

comments.content: B is correct. On page 266 of the Discovery Fundamentals Guide Book it says: "Note: Debug Mode is used to test pattern steps and verify variable values against a CI prior to running discovery".

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-operations-management/page/product/service-mapping/task/t_ActivateDebugMode.html

'Before starting this procedure, verify that the Debug mode is not activated. If the Debug mode is activated, the debug button appears with a green dot: .

Role required: pd_admin

Basic knowledge of programming is desirable.'

questions.question:
A discovery runs against a Windows Server returning the following attribute values for the first time: name = WindowsSN1 serial_number = 12321
A subsequent discovery runs against a different Windows Server returning the following attribute values: name = WindowsSN2 serial_number = 12321
With only base system CI Identifiers configured, which of the following is true?
answers: A. A Windows Server CI is created, then updated with WindowsSN2 as the name.
B. Two Windows Sewer CIs are created, with WindowsSN1 AND WindowsSN2 for names.
C. Two Windows Server CIs are created, without serial_number values.
D. A Windows Server CI is created, then updated with WindowsSN1 as the name.

comments.content: the question says "subsequent discovery is run against a different windows server" this implies that there is a second windows server to consider. In this case, the answer has to be B.
A = serial number match as unique
I believe A is the correct answer

the OOB IRE rule has a higher priority for the serial number (derived from the Hardware Class),  IRE will stop with the first matching condition that delivery a unique identification, therefore it would consider the serialnumber as significant. Thus I opt for A
I would say the answer is A, it would only NOT update the name if a less authoritative  data source was used.
looks to be A as unique serial
A as the serial number unique.
NOT sure why 2 new data needs to be created

questions.question: Which of the following choices must be installed on a MID Server to run Credential-less Discovery?

comments.content:
If the instance fails to identify a configuration item (CI) because of authentication failure, Discovery or Service Mapping can run selected Network Mapper (Nmap) commands with a MID Server to collect some basic information about the CI without using credentials.

From: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-operations-management/page/product/discovery/concept/nmap-credential-less-discovery.html

questions.question:
A network device has both an SSH port and an SNMP port open. Discovery tries the SSH probe first and it fails. This triggers the SNMP probe, which succeeds. Discovery uses SNMP first for subsequent discoveries on that device.
What discovery functionality allows the above to happen?

comments.content:
What IP Service Affinity Does (per the documentation):

	“The IP service affinity functionality stores a mapping between an IP address, port, and the application service class that Discovery identified on that port.”

So:
	•	It remembers what application (e.g., Apache, Oracle, Tomcat) was found running on a specific IP/port combo.
	•	This helps ServiceNow optimize future discoveries of application services, not infrastructure.
A system property called glide.discovery.ip_service_affinity allows Discovery to remember the last port of the IP address that was discovered. This property is set to false by default.
Credential affinity has nothing to do with choosing the order of ports/services to probe.
I believe it is an IP Service Affinity, so I would say D

questions.question: Which of the below choices are horizontal pattern types? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
A pattern is a sequence of commands whose purpose it is to detect attributes of a CI and its outbound connections. Service Mapping and Discovery share a set of preconfigured patterns that cover most of the commonly used devices and applications. Patterns can be of the infrastructure or application type. Infrastructure patterns are used only by Discovery for creating lists of devices. Application patterns serve both Service Mapping and Discovery, which use the same application patterns for their purposes. For example, Discovery runs the horizontal discovery with the Apache Web Server pattern to find and list all Apache Web Servers in your organization. Service Mapping runs the top-down discovery using the same pattern to discover a specific Apache Web Server and place it on an application service map.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-operations-management/page/product/service-mapping/concept/c_MappingPatternsCustomization.html

questions.question: What does the MID Server need to collect vCenter events?
answers: B. MID SNMP Trap Listener extension

questions.question:
A Discovery Schedule contains a /24 subnet IP Range and a Shazzam batch size of 5000.
How many times will a Shazzam probe be launched during discovery?

comments.content:
A. 1

For example, a schedule is created to scan 100,000 IP addresses, with 10 MID Servers assigned to do the work. Each MID Server is assigned to scan 10,000 IP addresses. If the Shazzam batch size is set to 5,000 IP addresses per probe, the schedule runs two Shazzam probes per MID Server (10,000 IP addresses/5,000 per batch). These probes are run in sequence and not concurrently.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-operations-management/page/product/discovery/task/t_CreateADiscoverySchedule.html
A /24 subnet contains 253 usable IPs. And if the Shazzam batch size is configured as 5000. Only one Shazam probe needs to be created to complete the scan.

questions.question: Which method is used by Discovery to determine if a Host IP is active or alive?

comments.content: I think Discovery no longer pings devices, so I think the (most) correct answer here is A

I believe SNOW dumped ping awhile ago. While it is possible to have a CI that has all listening ports closed, it is highly unlikely to the point of near-impossibility (because any device active on a network will always have at least one port open, even if it's open temporarily to receive return packets).
I would say A - first stage

questions.question: Which of the following choices explain differences between Service Mapping and Discovery? (Choose two.)

B. Discovery finds applications and devices on your network, Service Mapping monitors those devices.
C. Discovery utilizes IP address ranges for initial discovery, Service Mapping uses entry points.
D. Discovery addresses inventory-related use-cases, while Service Mapping allows for the creation of accurate maps of application service topologies.

I would say C and D

questions.question: Which of the following is required for a MID Server to have access to automatically stay up-to-date with instance versions?
When designing steps with operations requiring variables, it is best practice to do what?
answers: D. design for a static environment

comments.content:
C is correct.

B is nonsense bcs. you could also use tabular or vector variables.

I have to say B for one reason: If you query targets, you will get a specific variable that may only work for that target. With a Scalar variable, the variable will work for a wider variation of targets.
